intro: Byrsocarpus goetzei, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. Byrsocarpus goetzei is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
